00027 /**
00028  * @brief Spawning of Ruby on Rails application instances.
00029  *
00030  * This class is responsible for spawning new instances of Ruby on Rails applications.
00031  * Use the spawn() method to do so.
00032  *
00033  * @note This class is fully thread-safe.
00034  *
00035  * <h2>Implementation details</h2>
00036  * Internally, this class makes use of a spawn server, which is written in Ruby. This server
00037  * is automatically started when a SpawnManager instance is created, and automatically
00038  * shutdown when that instance is destroyed. The existance of the spawn server is almost
00039  * totally transparent to users of this class. Spawn requests are sent to the server,
00040  * and details about the spawned process is returned.
00041  *
00042  * If the spawn server dies during the middle of an operation, it will be restarted.
00043  * See spawn() for full details.
00044  *
00045  * The communication channel with the server is anonymous, i.e. no other processes
00046  * can access the communication channel, so communication is guaranteed to be safe
00047  * (unless, of course, if the spawn server itself is a trojan).
00048  *
00049  * The server will try to keep the spawning time as small as possible, by keeping
00050  * corresponding Ruby on Rails frameworks and application code in memory. So the second
00051  * time an instance of the same application is spawned, the spawn time is significantly
00052  * lower than the first time. Nevertheless, spawning is a relatively expensive operation
00053  * (compared to the processing of a typical HTTP request/response), and so should be
00054  * avoided whenever possible.
00055  *
00056  * See the documentation of the spawn server for full implementation details.
00057  */
00058 class SpawnManager {
00059 private:
00060         string spawnServerCommand;
00061         string logFile;
00062         string environment;
00063         string rubyCommand;
00064         
00065         mutex lock;
00066         
00067         MessageChannel channel;
00068         pid_t pid;
00069         bool serverNeedsRestart;

00071         /**
00072          * Restarts the spawn server.
00073          *
00074          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server.
00075          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00076          */
00077         void restartServer() {
00078                 if (pid != 0) {
00079                         channel.close();
00080                         // TODO: should not wait infinitely
00081                         waitpid(pid, NULL, 0);
00082                         pid = 0;
00083                 }
00084                 
00085                 int fds[2];
00086                 FILE *logFileHandle = NULL;
00087                 
00088                 serverNeedsRestart = true;
00089                 if (socketpair(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, fds) == -1) {
00090                         throw SystemException("Cannot create a Unix socket", errno);
00091                 }
00092                 if (!logFile.empty()) {
00093                         logFileHandle = fopen(logFile.c_str(), "a");
00094                         if (logFileHandle == NULL) {
00095                                 string message("Cannot open log file '");
00096                                 message.append(logFile);
00097                                 message.append("' for writing.");
00098                                 throw IOException(message);
00099                         }
00100                 }
00101 
00102                 pid = fork();
00103                 if (pid == 0) {
00104                         if (!logFile.empty()) {
00105                                 dup2(fileno(logFileHandle), STDERR_FILENO);
00106                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00107                         }
00108                         dup2(STDERR_FILENO, STDOUT_FILENO);
00109                         if (!environment.empty()) {
00110                                 setenv("RAILS_ENV", environment.c_str(), true);
00111                         }
00112                         dup2(fds[1], STDIN_FILENO);
00113                         close(fds[0]);
00114                         close(fds[1]);
00115                         
00116                         // Close all other file descriptors
00117                         for (long i = sysconf(_SC_OPEN_MAX) - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00118                                 if (i != STDIN_FILENO && i != STDOUT_FILENO && i != STDERR_FILENO) {
00119                                         close(i);
00120                                 }
00121                         }
00122                         
00123                         execlp(rubyCommand.c_str(), rubyCommand.c_str(), spawnServerCommand.c_str(), NULL);
00124                         int e = errno;
00125                         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to run %s: %s\n", rubyCommand.c_str(), strerror(e));
00126                         fflush(stderr);
00127                         _exit(1);
00128                 } else if (pid == -1) {
00129                         int e = errno;
00130                         close(fds[0]);
00131                         close(fds[1]);
00132                         if (logFileHandle != NULL) {
00133                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00134                         }
00135                         pid = 0;
00136                         throw SystemException("Unable to fork a process", e);
00137                 } else {
00138                         close(fds[1]);
00139                         if (!logFile.empty()) {
00140                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00141                         }
00142                         channel = MessageChannel(fds[0]);
00143                         serverNeedsRestart = false;
00144                 }
00145         }

00149          * Thrown when SpawnManager tried to restart the spawn server, but failed.
00150          * Use getSubException() to find out more details about the failure.
00151          */

00153         private:
00154                 shared_ptr<exception> m_subexception;
00155         public:
00156                 RestartException(shared_ptr<exception> subexception)
00157                         : m_subexception(subexception) {}
00158                 
00159                 virtual ~RestartException() throw() {}

00162                         return m_subexception->what();
00163                 }
00164

00166                  * An exception which contains more details about why the restart failed.

00173         /**
00174          * Construct a new SpawnManager.
00175          *
00176          * @param spawnServerCommand The filename of the spawn server to use.
00177          * @param logFile Specify a log file that the spawn manager should use.
00178          *            Messages on its standard output and standard error channels
00179          *            will be written to this log file. If an empty string is
00180          *            specified, no log file will be used, and the spawn server
00181          *            will use the same standard output/error channels as the
00182          *            current process.
00183          * @param environment The RAILS_ENV environment that all RoR applications
00184          *            should use. If an empty string is specified, the current value
00185          *            of the RAILS_ENV environment variable will be used.
00186          * @param rubyCommand The Ruby interpreter's command.
00187          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server.
00188          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00189          */
00190         SpawnManager(const string &spawnServerCommand,
00191                      const string &logFile = "",
00192                      const string &environment = "production",
00193                      const string &rubyCommand = "ruby") {
00194                 this->spawnServerCommand = spawnServerCommand;
00195                 this->logFile = logFile;
00196                 this->environment = environment;
00197                 this->rubyCommand = rubyCommand;
00198                 pid = 0;
00199                 restartServer();
00200         }

00202         ~SpawnManager() throw() {
00203                 if (pid != 0) {
00204                         channel.close();
00205                         waitpid(pid, NULL, 0);
00206                 }
00207         }

00209         /**
00210          * Spawn a new instance of a Ruby on Rails application.
00211          *
00212          * If something went wrong in the server during the spawning process,
00213          * then an IOException or a SystemException will be thrown. The server will
00214          * be restarted next time spawn() is called. If the server crashes during
00215          * the restart, a RestartException will be thrown.
00216          *
00217          * @param appRoot The application root of a RoR application, i.e. the folder that
00218          *             contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/', etc. This must be a valid directory,
00219          *             but the path does not have to be absolute.
00220          * @param user The user to run the instance as.
00221          * @param group The group to run the instance as.
00222          * @return A smart pointer to an Application object, which represents the application
00223          *         instance that has been spawned. Use this object to communicate with the
00224          *         spawned application.
00225          * @throws IOException Something went wrong during spawning.
00226          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during spawning.
00227          * @throws RestartException An attempt to restart the spawn server was made, but that failed.
00228          */
00229         ApplicationPtr spawn(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") {
00230                 vector<string> args;
00231                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00232                 
00233                 if (serverNeedsRestart) {
00234                         // TODO: This is not the best place to restart the server.
00235                         // Ideally a spawn() should fail as least as possible.
00236                         try {
00237                                 P_TRACE("Restarting spawn server.");
00238                                 restartServer();
00239                         } catch (const IOException &e) {
00240                                 P_TRACE("Failed to restart spawn server: " << e.what());
00241                                 shared_ptr<IOException> copy(new IOException(e));
00242                                 throw RestartException(copy);
00243                         } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00244                                 P_TRACE("Failed to restart spawn server: " << e.what());
00245                                 shared_ptr<SystemException> copy(new SystemException(e));
00246                                 throw RestartException(copy);
00247                         }
00248                 }
00249         
00250                 try {
00251                         channel.write("spawn_application", appRoot.c_str(), user.c_str(), group.c_str(), NULL);
00252                         if (!channel.read(args)) {
00253                                 throw IOException("The spawn server has exited unexpectedly.");
00254                         }
00255                         pid_t pid = atoi(args.front().c_str());
00256                         int listenSocket = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00257                         return ApplicationPtr(new Application(appRoot, pid, listenSocket));
00258                 } catch (const exception &e) {
00259                         P_TRACE("Spawn server died. Will restart it next time.");
00260                         serverNeedsRestart = true;
00261                         throw;
00262                 }
00263         }
00264 };
